title: How do you usually commute to work? Describe your typical commute.

korean: 매일 아침 지하철로 출근하는데, 러시아워가 정말 힘들어.
집에서 역까지는 걸어서 가는데, 10분 정도 걸려.
아침 운동 삼아서 빨리 걷는 편인데, 늦을 때는 뛰어가기도 해.
지하철은 7시 반쯤 타는데, 이미 사람들로 꽉 차 있어.
출근 시간대엔 자리에 앉는 건 포기해야 해, 서서 가는 거 익숙해졌어.
이어폰 끼고 음악 들으면서 가면 시간이 좀 빨리 가더라고.
요즘은 팟캐스트 듣는 재미에 빠져서 출퇴근이 덜 지루해.
회사까지는 총 40분 정도 걸리는데, 너무 멀지도 가깝지도 않아.
퇴근길은 조금 여유로운데, 그래도 사람은 많아.
피곤한 날엔 지하철에서 졸 때도 있는데, 내릴 역 놓칠까 봐 긴장돼.
재택근무 날이 있으면 좋겠는데, 아직은 어렵나 봐.
english: Well, I commute to work by subway every morning, and, you know, rush hour is really tough.
I walk from home to the station, and it takes, like, about 10 minutes.
I walk pretty fast as a morning exercise, but when I'm late, I, um, run sometimes.
I get on the subway around 7:30, and it's, like, already packed with people.
During rush hour, I have to, you know, give up on finding a seat, I've gotten used to standing.
When I put in my earbuds and listen to music, time goes by, like, a bit faster.
These days I'm into listening to podcasts, so, well, commuting is less boring.
I transfer at the transfer station, and that's when it's, like, most crowded.
It takes about 40 minutes total to get to work, which is, you know, neither too far nor too close.
The commute home is a bit more relaxed, but, well, it's still crowded.
On tired days, I sometimes, like, doze off on the subway, but I get nervous about missing my stop.
It would be nice to have work-from-home days, but, you know, I guess that's still difficult.
